questions.text: How many tangents can a circle have?
questions.explanation: A circle has infinite points, so infinite tangents.

questions.text: A tangent PQ at a point P of a circle of radius 5 cm meets a line through the centre O at a point Q so that OQ = 12 cm. Length PQ is:
If tangents PA and PB from a point P to a circle with centre O are inclined to each other at angle of 80°, then ∠POA is equal to:
The length of a tangent from a point A at distance 5 cm from the centre of the circle is 4 cm. The radius of the circle is:
Two parallel lines touch the circle at points A and B. If area of the circle is 25π cm², then AB is:
questions.explanation: Area=25π => r=5. Parallel tangents are at ends of diameter. AB = 10.

questions.text: In figure, if ∠AOB = 125°, then ∠COD is equal to:
questions.explanation: Opposite sides of quadrilateral circumscribing a circle subtend supplementary angles at centre. 180 - 125 = 55.

questions.text: At one end A of a diameter AB of a circle of radius 5 cm, tangent XAY is drawn. The length of the chord CD parallel to XY and at a distance 8 cm from A is:

Assertion (A): If length of a tangent from an external point to a circle is 8 cm, then length of the other tangent from the same point is 8 cm.
Reason (R): Lengths of tangents drawn from an external point to a circle are equal.
options: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation
Both true but R not explanation
questions.answer: (a) Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation

questions.text:
Assertion (A): The tangents drawn at the ends of a diameter of a circle are parallel.
Reason (R): The angle between the tangent and the radius at the point of contact is 90°.
options: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation
Both true but R not explanation
questions.answer: (a) Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation

questions.text:
Assertion (A): In the figure, PA and PB are tangents. If ∠APB = 40°, then ∠AOB = 140°.
Reason (R): The angle between two tangents drawn from an external point is supplementary to the angle subtended by the line segment joining the points of contact at the centre.
options: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation
Both true but R not explanation
questions.answer: (a) Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation

questions.text: Prove that the tangents drawn at the ends of a diameter of a circle are parallel.
In figure, a circle touches all the four sides of a quadrilateral ABCD whose sides are AB = 6 cm, BC = 9 cm and CD = 8 cm. Find the length of side AD.
Two concentric circles are of radii 5 cm and 3 cm. Find the length of the chord of the larger circle which touches the smaller circle.
A quadrilateral ABCD is drawn to circumscribe a circle. Prove that AB + CD = AD + BC.
In figure, if ∠ATO = 40°, find ∠AOB.
In figure, common tangents AB and CD to the two circles intersect at E. Prove that AB = CD.
If the angle between two tangents drawn from an external point P to a circle of radius a and centre O, is 60°, then find the length of OP.
Prove that the parallelogram circumscribing a circle is a rhombus.
Prove that opposite sides of a quadrilateral circumscribing a circle subtend supplementary angles at the centre of the circle.
In Figure, XY and X'Y' are two parallel tangents to a circle with centre O and another tangent AB with point of contact C intersecting XY at A and X'Y' at B. Prove that ∠ AOB = 90°.
In figure, PQ is a chord of length 8 cm of a circle of radius 5 cm. The tangents at P and Q intersect at a point T. Find the length TP.

A triangle ABC is drawn to circumscribe a circle of radius 4 cm such that the segments BD and DC into which BC is divided by the point of contact D are of lengths 8 cm and 6 cm respectively. Find the sides AB and AC.
In figure, AP and BP are tangents to a circle with centre O, such that AP = 5 cm and ∠APB = 60°. Find the length of chord AB.
If a hexagon ABCDEF circumscribe a circle, prove that AB + CD + EF = BC + DE + FA.
Prove that the lengths of tangents drawn from an external point to a circle are equal.
Prove that the tangent at any point of a circle is perpendicular to the radius through the point of contact.
In two concentric circles, the radii are r and 6 cm. Chord CD of larger circle is a tangent to smaller circle. If PA=16cm and OP=20cm, find the length CD.
Tangents PQ and PR are drawn from an external point P to a circle with centre O, such that ∠RPQ = 30°. A chord RS is drawn parallel to the tangent PQ. Find ∠RQS.
